meanings.definition: The quality of being excessively eager to offer unwanted help or advice.
meanings.sent1: Her officiousnesses in trying to fix everything often led to more problems.
meanings.sent2: His officiousnesses at the office made his coworkers feel suffocated.
meanings.sent3: The cat's officiousnesses in trying to catch the bird only caused chaos in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The tree's officiousnesses in spreading its branches too far blocked the sunlight from reaching the smaller plants.
meanings.sent5: The officiousnesses of the overprotective parent made it hard for the child to learn independence.

meanings.definition: An instance of being overly assertive in offering help or advice.
meanings.sent1: The officiousnesses of the salesperson made the customer uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: During the meeting, his officiousnesses were evident as he interrupted everyone to share his opinions.
meanings.sent3: The robot's officiousnesses in trying to assist with every task ended up causing more confusion.
meanings.sent4: The officiousnesses of the traffic officer directing cars made the intersection even more chaotic.
meanings.sent5: The officiousnesses of the tour guide made the tourists feel like they had no freedom to explore on their own.
